alert.note: Alert for Stevens; Swift (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 5:13PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN STEVENS AND NORTHWESTERN SWIFT COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM CDT... At 513 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Oliver, or 17 miles south of Morris, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Stevens and northwestern Swift Counties, including the following locations... Holloway. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 17 and 28. U.S. Highway 59 between mile markers 143 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
